--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Coli=
n Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> Just a quickie then...
> 
> skithe=
rock wrote:
> >
> > The problem is that when I try to compile the above cod=
e, I get the
> > error: "An object reference is required for the nonstatic =
field,
> > method, or property
> >
'SharpNeatLibExperiments.INetworkEvaluat=
or.ExtractNetworkPerformance(SharpNeatLib.NeuralNetwork.INetwork)'(CS0120)
=
> >   
> 
> Yep you are calling ExtractNetworkPerformance on the interface =
itself 
> which only contains static methods and properties. What you need =
is an 
> actual object that implements that interface. You probably already=
 
> created such an object inside your IExperiment class, you probably just=
 
> need to keep a reference to that available somewhere.
> 
> Sorry I can'=
t reply in more detail right now as I'm off to work!
> 
> Colin.
>
